intro: Emex centropodium, commonly known as the red brome, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, reddish-brown seeds. Emex centropodium thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush areas. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
